div.class: ds-1col entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-text pc-left pc-important view-mode-full clearfix

p.strong: Humboldt County Shelter In Place Order Effective March 30, 2020 Until Rescinded

br.strong: CLOSED FOR THE REST OF THE SCHOOL YEAR. ONLINE ENRICHMENT LEARNING WILL CONTINUE THOUGH JUNE 11, 2020

p.br: Whether the school closure lasts a few more weeks or a few more months, the staff at the South Bay Union Elementary School District are here for you. Should you need anything or have questions about anything, please fill out this short Request for Assistance Form and a member of South Bay's dedicated team will get in touch with you within 48 hours. We're in this together. #pinehill&southbaystrong

Drop by South Bay between 8:00am-11:00am or until supplies run out to pick up a 5 day supply of breakfast and lunch for ALL the children in your household. Food will NOT be distributed at Pine Hill. During the county-wide Shelter-In-Place, we will be offering a week of meals in one day. If you know of other families that need food for their children please let them know this is open to all families in the area.

hr.p: Throughout the school closure, the South Bay Union Elementary School District will continue to assess our efforts to ensure that we meet your needs.

Dear Pine Hill and South Bay Community,
The shelter-in-place order has taught us quite a bit about our beloved Pine Hill and South Bay schools. Four weeks into our distance learning efforts, I couldn’t be more proud to be associated with each and every one of you. In short order, staff took on many monumental tasks. Focused first on equitable access to basic needs and services, our dedicated department leads ensured food security for the children in our community, while also identifying and assisting each family that needed support securing reliable internet access. Within 24 hours of closing our campus doors, teachers where ready to begin delivering educational opportunities to our students. The community support during the first month of our new reality has been warmly received and is greatly appreciated. On Monday, April 20, we return from Spring Break, as we do with all our South Bay School District efforts, we study our surroundings, engage our families, then pause and ask ourselves, “What subtle adjustments can we make to enhance our efforts?” Our answer, to prioritize community, connectedness, and relationships. Inside each household, our stress levels are likely to rise in the upcoming weeks. Anticipating that challenge, when we return from Spring Break, on Mondays and Fridays, our remarkable teachers are planning to bookend each week with class meetings. Additionally, teachers will hold weekly check-ins with students. And finally, regular remote office hours will be scheduled so students and parents can ask their teachers questions, or to just pop-in to say “hello” – we miss our students as much as they miss us. Academically, our priorities will focus on the basics — Reading, Writing, and Arithmetic. For families able to extend home learning beyond these foundational areas, your teachers and principals will provide a menu of additional learning opportunities that you are encouraged to explore. More information on Pine Hill and South Bay priorities and opportunities will be communicated over the next couple of days. Most importantly, let’s continue to support one another during this unprecedented time. While social distancing makes it impossible to literally lean on one another, we can still support one another. P lease know that Pine Hill and South Bay are here for the long-haul. Should you need assistance, please click on our Request for Assistance form, and we will reach out to you as quickly as possible. Please continue to shelter-in-place. Our efforts to slow the spread of COVID-19 are working! Together, with a united effort, our resilient community will make it through these challenging times. Stay safe and stay healthy.
My Very Best,
Gary Storts
Superintendent, South Bay Union Elementary School District

div.p: Information about the North Coasts' newest INDEPENDENT STUDY PROGRAM at SOUTH BAY CHARTER. More Information

hr.p: OUR ONLINE FREE AND REDUCED MEAL APPLICATION is quick and easy to use. This allows you, the parent/guardian, to submit your applications conveniently from any internet-accessible computer. Use this direct link to begin the application process.

p.br: It is vital that we have current email and phone numbers for our families. As evident by last weeks power outage, we need to be able to communicate information about school with our families. If you did not get the emails and phone calls regarding our communication during the power outage please contact us and confirm your contact information. It is also important to add donotreply@southbayusd.org to your email contact list, this is the email that sends out parent alert notifications. Thank you for helping us to keep you in the loop about your child's education.

We are looking to hire some additional substitute teacher and have raised our daily rate of pay. Please help spread the word about our needs! Thank you!
Substitue Teachers Brochure

We are still hiring for a variety of aide positions. Positive, encouraging, caring, and reliable individuals with a desire to help students succeed academically, socially, and emotionally are encouraged to apply. If you are available during the day and would like to make a positive impact on our students and school, please consider applying. You can view our available positions and apply online through EdJoin at the following address: EdJoin

div.p: Last Day of School - Summer Begins
